If I contribute X and Claude contributes Y, the pool becomes (X+Y)*1.6, and we each get (X+Y)*0.8. So I get (X+Y)*0.8 + (10-X) = 10 - X + 0.8*(X+Y) = 10 + 0.8*Y - 0.2*X. This means I benefit when Claude contributes, but my own contribution costs me 0.2 per point. However, mutual cooperation yields the best total outcome. I'll start with a generous but not maximum contribution to signal cooperation while protecting against potential free-riding.
